top_insights: Critical switching load: 159.8 switches/hour on average (≈8x normal; >1.5x the critical threshold), with a peak of 344/hour.
Micro-sessioning: average session 1.8 minutes; 48.6% of sessions are <0.9 minutes, and only 12.5% exceed 3.6 minutes—insufficient for deep work.
Tool sprawl: 83 unique windows in 3.52 hours indicates heavy context dispersion and attention residue.
Workday diffusion: 3.52 logged hours spread across 8 active hours suggests start–stop patterns and low efficiency, increasing cognitive fatigue.
Circadian exposure is early, not late: 0% evening work (protective), but 10.3% early-morning work may compress sleep if not a morning chronotype.

flags.message: Sustained hyper-switching (159.8/hr) with a spike to 344/hr and 83 unique windows indicates extreme attention fragmentation and high cognitive switching costs.
flags.prescription: Cap real-time switching to ≤60/hour: enable Do Not Disturb during focus blocks, batch communications to 10:30, 14:00, and 16:30, and use single-workspace mode with ≤12 open windows. Pre-open only the task’s primary doc/app plus one support window. If switching exceeds 60/hour for 5 minutes, pause and reset.

flags.message: Average session is 1.8 minutes; 48.6% of sessions are under 0.9 minutes, while only 12.5% exceed 3.6 minutes—no sustained focus blocks.
flags.prescription: Run 3 ultradian cycles: 50 minutes focus + 10 minutes break. Within each focus block, commit to one task and keep only essential windows open. End each block with a 3-minute log/plan. Target at least two uninterrupted ≥25-minute blocks today.

flags.message: 83 unique windows in 3.52 hours suggests excessive app/tab hopping and interface friction.
flags.prescription: Consolidate tooling: dedicate virtual desktops to specific contexts (e.g., Desktop 1: Writing, Desktop 2: Comms). Reduce open windows from 83 to ≤15 by closing/parking nonessential apps, using tab groups, and launching task-specific presets.

flags.message: 3.52 logged hours spread over 8 active hours implies frequent task starts/stops and elongated cognitive load across the day.
flags.prescription: Compress the day into two protected blocks (09:30–11:30, 13:30–15:30). Outside these windows, do only low-stakes admin or rest. Set Slack/email ‘office hours’ to those blocks and enforce a hard stop at 16:00 to reduce active hours from 8 to ≤5.

flags.message: 0% evening work is protective, but 10.3% early-morning activity risks sleep compression if wake time drifts earlier without compensating bedtime.
flags.prescription: Set an earliest work boundary at 07:30 for 14 days. If early work is unavoidable, limit to ≤30 minutes and avoid high-cognitive tasks. Aim for 7.5–9 hours sleep and get 20–30 minutes of outdoor morning light within 60 minutes of waking.

flags.message: Recent 15-minute interval with 86 switches (~344/hr) indicates an acute overload period prone to errors and stress.
flags.prescription: Install a threshold-triggered reset: if switches >30 in 15 minutes, take a 3-minute break (stand up, 8 cycles of 4-4-4-4 breathing), write the single next task, and reopen only the required window before resuming.
